alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 8:50PM CDT until May 31 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County.

Trinity River At Trinidad affecting Navarro and Henderson
Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River Near Easterly affecting Leon and Robertson
Counties.

West Fork Trinity River Near Boyd affecting Wise County.

...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in
Texas...

West Fork Trinity River Near Jacksboro affecting Jack County.

Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Trinidad.

* WHEN...Until early Saturday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 37.0 feet, Minor flooding to woodlands and low land
areas will occur on the right bank of the river.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 33.8 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 33.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 33.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 36.0
feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood
stage early Friday afternoon.

alerts.description:

Lamar, or near Rockport, moving northeast at 10 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is
possible.

Rockport, Lamar, Aransas Pass, Palm Harbor, Key Allegro, Holiday
Beach, Aransas National Wildlife Refuge, Copano Village, and Fulton.

alerts.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 28 at 5:03AM CDT until May 28 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
alerts.description:
At 503 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated
thunderstorms produced heavy rain. Several low water crossings are
reported flooded. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash
flooding is already occurring.

HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing
flash flooding.

SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.

IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams,
urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.

Some locations that will experience flash flooding include...
San Antonio, Kerrville, Boerne, Comfort, Bandera, Leon Valley,
Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Cross Mountain, Kronkosky State Natural
Area, Pipe Creek, Bandera Falls, Nelson City, Welfare, Lakehills,
Center Point, Walnut Grove, Waring, Camp Verde and Cypress Creek.
